summary.p: In contrast to Bullinger's pessimistic last letter No. 296, the council elections in Zürich have been successful for the friends of the Reformation: Many of them have been elected to the Small Council. Rumors of a large amount of French ? gold in Zürich. Bullinger requests news.

div.p: Grace and innocence of life from the Lord.

I wrote in my previous letters out of great mental disturbance, what was pressing[!]. Now, in turn, receive what the mind's concerns have somewhat more freely discussed. On December 13th, contrary to the wishes of the papists, the best were elected to the council: Nikolaus Brunner, a certain Schneeberger, not a bad man, and some good men from the dioceses. Furthermore, a weight of gold was found, about which, if they tell the truth and I myself ascertain the whole truth, I will report some remarkable things.
If you have anything from the Diet of Augsburg or about the alliance of the Pope and the French, write immediately. We have no news here.
To the most vigilant president of the Basel church, Mr. Oswald Myconius, dearest brother and fellow minister.
